snippet: The State Court of Criminal Appeals on Thursday upheld a judge’s ruling that a man convicted of raping a teenage neighbor should not serve prison time.
abstract: Alabama State Court of Criminal Appeals upholds ruling that Austin Clem, convicted of raping a teenage neighbor, should not serve prison time; Clem was sentenced to probation after the appellate court ruled that his original punishment, which included a stint in a corrections program, was unlawful.
lead_paragraph: The State Court of Criminal Appeals on Thursday upheld a judge’s ruling that a man convicted of raping a teenage neighbor should not serve prison time.

headline.main: Alabama: No Prison for Resentenced Rapist
headline.print_headline: Alabama: No Prison for Resentenced Rapist
